programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Civil War, America's South is looking to put the past behind it, and finds one path in a growing cultural passion of the North - football. In December 1932, the Southeastern Conference is officially formed.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: Multiple SEC schools claim national titles from the 1930s through the '50s, including LSU with star running back Billy Cannon in 1958, prior to Cannon's epic game-winning punt return against powerhouse Ole Miss a year later.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: In the 1960s, as Georgia Tech leaves the conference and the Civil Rights Movement becomes embedded in the history and image of the region, Bear Bryant, hired in 1958, becomes the face of Alabama - and SEC football.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: As a new decade dawns, quarterbacks Archie Manning, Bert Jones and Condredge Holloway build memorable legacies. Bear Bryant begins a new run of dominance at Alabama, and the rise of television sports transforms the SEC.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The 1980s begin with Herschel Walker leading Georgia to a national title as a freshman. After Bear Bryant retires in 1982 and passes away four weeks later, control of the SEC is eventually transferred to Pat Dye and Bo Jackson at Auburn.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The 1990s bring change, with expansion and the sport's first-ever conference championship game. Florida's Steve Spurrier fashions an era of high-octane offense, and his Gators form a rivalry with Tennessee and QB Peyton Manning.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: Nick Saban comes to LSU in 2000 and eventually wins the Tigers' first national championship since 1958 - a feat matched by Les Miles. At Florida, Tim Tebow becomes a cult hero and wins two national titles with Urban Meyer's Gators.

programme.title: Saturdays In the South: A History of SEC Football
programme.desc: The SEC has a run of seven straight national titles, and nine in 12 years. Expansion in 2012 gives the conference 14 schools. Meanwhile, Nick Saban arguably becomes the greatest coach in the history of college football.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The rise and fall of the USC Trojan football team under the nine-year leadership of Pete Carroll.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: An exploration of the class and power dynamics in college sports through the interconnected journeys of one-time dynamic running back Maurice Clarett and former elite head coach Jim Tressel.

programme.title: 2025 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Game 5.

programme.title: 2025 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Game 6.

programme.title: Live: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Gators (13-0) visit the No. 10 Wildcats (11-2) for a marquee SEC opener. Florida is off to the second-best start in program history behind the 2005-06 squad that began 17-0. The Gators stopped a five-game series slide last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Gators tip off against the No. 1 Volunteers. Florida dropped its conference opener, and first game of 2024-25, 106-100 to then-No. 10 Kentucky on Jan. 4. Tennessee remained the only unbeaten squad by waxing Arkansas 76-52 that same day.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Gators and their stifling defense visit the Razorbacks for an SEC contest. Florida is 14-1, 1-1 after holding No. 1 Tennessee to 21.4% shooting from the field in a 73-43 victory. Arkansas completes a three-game run against ranked teams.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Gators try to pick up the pieces as they welcome the Longhorns to the swamp. Florida's 16-game home win streak came to an end on Jan. 14 in an 83-82 defeat against Missouri. Texas went 0-3 versus a ranked-squad gauntlet to begin 2025.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Sooners seek an upset of the No. 2 Gators. Florida has won four in a row, while Oklahoma has dropped four straight. Florida guard Denzel Aberdeen matched his career-high with 20 points Feb. 11, then set a new personal best with 22 points Feb. 15.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Filmmaker Billy Corben documents the rise to prominence of the college football program at the University of Miami.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The University of Miami's football program tries to recover from the devastation left by NCAA sanctions and scandals.

programme.title: 2025 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Game 7.

programme.title: Live: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 7 Alabama (23-6, 12-4) continues a tough stretch to end the SEC regular season as No. 5 Florida (25-4, 12-4) visits. Alabama fell 79-76 at then-No. 5 Tennessee on March 1, and draws No. 1 Auburn for its final SEC Tournament tune-up on March 8.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Gators jump into the 2025 SEC Tournament fray by facing the No. 7 Tigers in the quarterfinals. Missouri halted a four-game series slide by shocking Florida 83-82 on Jan. 14. Mizzou ousted Mississippi State in its second-round opener.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Florida faces No. 3 Alabama in a second semifinal of heavyweights at the SEC Tournament. The Gators knocked off the Crimson Tide 99-94 on March 5 behind 27 points from Alex Condon. Florida seeks a second straight trip to the SEC finals.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Gators (29-4) seek atonement in the SEC Tournament final against the No. 4 Volunteers (27-6). Florida reached the 2024 title game but fell 86-67 to Auburn, leaving it without a crown since 2014. The teams split their regular-season series.

programme.title: Decade of Dominance
programme.desc: A commemorative look at the 10-year anniversary of the College Football Playoff that highlights the SEC's success across the last decade. During that time, the SEC earned 12 CFP appearances and six National Championships -- the most of any league.

programme.title: Them Dawgs
programme.desc: A look at the Georgia Bulldogs.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The fascinating back story behind the famous/infamous 1988 "Catholics vs. Convicts" college football game between Notre Dame and the University of Miami. The slogan summarized the subtext of cultural and racial tensions brewing between the schools.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The polarizing beliefs and on-field successes of former Colorado football coach Bill McCartney.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Tigers (13-1, 1-0 SEC) storm into the Moody Center for a match with the Longhorns (11-3, 0-1). Auburn extended its win streak to six in a row by topping Missouri on Jan. 4, while Texas dropped its first SEC contest, 80-60 to Texas A&M.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A hotly-anticipated SEC showdown sees the No. 6 Volunteers (17-2, 4-2) visit the No. 1 Tigers (17-1, 5-0). Tennessee looks to avenge a 92-84 loss to Auburn from 2023-24. Auburn has won 10 in a row after surviving then-No. 23 Georgia 70-68 on Jan. 18.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: History is made as the No. 1 Tigers visit the No. 2 Crimson Tide. This marks the first time in SEC history that the No. 1 and No. 2 teams will face off in the same game. Alabama has won seven in a row, while Auburn has won 15 of its past 16 overall.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Razorbacks (15-10, 4-8 SEC) mount a challenge against the No. 1 Tigers (23-2, 11-1). Auburn maintained its top-dog status by scoring a 94-85 victory at then-No. 2 Alabama on Feb. 15. Auburn earned an 83-51 verdict at Arkansas last season.
